alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 10:23PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving thunderstorm producing heavy rain will impact portions of central Harnett and central Cumberland Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1021 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Godwin, or 9 miles northeast of Fayetteville, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lillington, Fort Bragg, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Erwin, Eastover and Coats. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
